content: WASHINGTON Defense contractor Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc will pay $9.2 million to settle civil charges that it violated the False Claims Act by overbilling for labor on U.S. Navy and Coast Guard ships  the U.S. Justice Department said Tuesday.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: Shipbuilder Huntington Ingalls to pay $9.2 million over false claims case

title: Huntington Ingalls in bid for services company Camber: sources

content: Oct 21 Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc  is in talks to buy government services contractor Camber Corp for nearly $400 million as the U.S.'s largest military shipbuilder diversifies  people familiar with the situation said.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: Huntington Ingalls in bid for services company Camber -sources

content: WASHINGTON  March 29 Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc Chief Executive Mike Petters urged the U.S. Navy to accelerate its new LX(R) dock landing ship program to fiscal 2018 from 2020 to avoid significant costs associated with restarting a production line.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: Huntington Ingalls CEO urges speedup of next amphib ship program

content: WASHINGTON  Sept 1 Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc  which builds aircraft carriers and U.S. Navy warships  on Tuesday said it was keen to bid to build new icebreakers for the U.S. Coast Guard  after President Barack Obama pushed for quicker work on the program.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: Huntington Ingalls cites interest in building new U.S. icebreakers

content: WASHINGTON  Sept 1 U.S. Navy shipbuilders Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc and General Dynamics Corp on Tuesday said they were keen to build new icebreakers for the Coast Guard  after President Barack Obama pushed for quicker work on the program.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Huntington Ingalls  GD eager to build U.S. icebreakers

content: WASHINGTON  July 30 Admiral John Richardson  President Barack Obama's nominee for chief of naval operations  vowed on Thursday to tackle cost overruns on new Huntington Ingalls Industries aircraft carriers and to keep a sharp eye on other key weapons programs.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: U.S. Navy chief nominee vows focus on procurement costs

content: WASHINGTON  June 5 Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc on Friday won two contracts worth a combined $4.3 billion to complete design work and construction of the USS John F. Kennedy aircraft carrier  the Pentagon said in its daily digest of major contracts.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: UPDATE 1-Huntington Ingalls wins $4.3 bln in U.S. Navy carrier deals

title: Huntington Ingalls wins $4.3 billion in U.S. Navy carrier deals

content: WASHINGTON (This Jan 13 story corrects position of Marine Corps general and makes clear he speaks for Navy)
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: U.S. Marine general sees competition for next amphibious ship

content: WASHINGTON  Jan 13 The U.S. Marine Corps will insist on competition for the next U.S. amphibious warship despite a decision last year to base the ship on the LPD-17 ship designed by Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc  Major General Robert Walsh said on Tuesday.
name: Huntington Ingalls Industries Inc
title: UPDATE 1-U.S. Marine general sees competition for next amphibious ship

title: U.S. Marine general sees competition for next amphibious ship
